title: Quiz 9: Community and SBCC Scenarios
topicName: HIV, AIDS and STIs Comprehensive Teaching Manual
description: Apply knowledge of SBCC and HCBC to community scenarios.

questions.question: Scenario: You want to educate youth about HIV using an entertaining format. Which channel is best?
questions.explanation: Edutainment is highly effective for youth engagement.
questions.hint: Something they enjoy watching or listening to.

questions.question: Scenario: A community is resisting HIV testing due to stigma. Which SBCC strategies would help? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Share stories of people living positively

questions.explanation: Positive strategies, leadership involvement, and dialogue reduce stigma. Fear appeals often backfire.

questions.question: To ensure a referral network functions, there must be a ___BLANK___ loop to track if the patient received services.
questions.explanation: A feedback loop ensures the referral was completed.

questions.question: Match the behavior change stage to the appropriate intervention:
questions.explanation: Interventions must match the stage of change.
questions.hint: Match the need to the stage.

questions.question: In a Home Based Care setting, it is the role of the Community Health Volunteer (CHV) to diagnose opportunistic infections.
questions.explanation: Diagnosis is a clinical role. CHVs identify signs, support, and refer.

questions.question: Order the steps for developing an SBCC strategy:
questions.explanation: Standard design framework: Identify -> Assess -> Develop -> Test -> Implement.

questions.question: What is the term for a hand-off of a patient from one service to another?
questions.explanation: Referral is the process of linking a client to another service.

questions.question: Which of the following is an 'enabling factor' for behavior change?
questions.explanation: Supportive policies create an environment where change is possible.
